title: Principal Test Automation Engineer – Server Software
body:
Company Overview:
Nuance is the pioneer and leader in conversational artificial intelligence (AI) innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. We deliver solutions that understand, analyze, and respond to people, amplifying human intelligence to increase productivity and improve security. With decades of both domain and AI expertise, we work with thousands of organizations across a wide range of industries.

Join our team! At Nuance, we are constantly reinventing how people connect with technology and with each other. Our AI-powered solutions empower organizations to transform “business as usual.” For decades, the world’s leading financial, healthcare, telecommunications, retailers, and government organizations have trusted Nuance to bring them award-winning solutions that deliver more meaningful outcomes and empower a smarter, more connected world. From clinical speech recognition technologies that free physicians to spend more time caring for patients to real-time intelligence that powers billions of customer interactions, we’re deeply committed to helping organizations push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Job Summary:
Our Vienna teams focusing on Nuance Dragon Medical One, a secure, cloud-based, clinical speech recognition product used in the Healthcare industry, are looking for Principal Test Automation Engineer.

You’ll work in a scrum team on our Dragon Medical Server software stack and implement automation tasks, such as quality assurance and deployment. You will be responsible for the definition and implementation of automation concepts and enable the rest of the team to use it in an agile way.

You’ll have the opportunity to work on the latest and greatest technologies used in the cloud and speech recognition field to keep developing this complex product further - you’ll always be facing new challenges as the product constantly grows and evolves.

And did you know that Vienna has been named the best city in the world to live in for the 10th year running?

Responsibilities
  • Creation and maintenance of an automation concept and design for the Dragon Medical Server software stack
  • Evaluation of currently used and industry best practice automation technologies
  • Collaboration with CM/CI team, collaboration with data center deployment team
  • Consult with scrum teams and Solution Architects on software and system design in order to facilitate test automation.
  • Develop and reinforce testing methods, procedures for measuring product quality, and determining release readiness.
  • Enhance, extend, and maintain test automation libraries and frameworks.
  • Design and develop automated unit, functional, regression and performance test programs or scripts based on libraries of reusable test code modules or functions.
  • Actively participate as a scrum team member in all phases of the development process.
  • Perform peer design and code reviews.
  • Ability to multi-task and stay organized in a dynamic work environment.
  • Participate in functional and technical reviews/sprint reviews.
  • Effectively work with multiple stakeholders and teams located in different geographical locations.
  • Perform tasks related to securing and keeping the products, tools, and processes that you are responsible for secure.
Required skills:
  • Master's degree in computer science, engineering, math or related field or equivalent work experience
  • Web services, cloud, software architecture, statistics
  • Any of the following programming languages: .net languages, C++, C#, Java
  • Test Frameworks such as WinAppDriver, Selenium, TestComplete
  • Microsoft Operating systems & technologies
  • Experience with agile development methodology (Scrum, TDD)
  • Experience with automation of client and server-side enterprise class applications.
  • Excellent English communication skills (written, oral, listening).
  • Excellent technical analytical, debugging and problem-solving skills.
  • Has a reasonable balance between getting the job done vs technical debt.
  • Enjoys delivering top quality in a fast-moving environment.
  • Enjoys working in a team; willingness to put the needs of the team over their own.
  • Profound knowledge about agile principles and concepts.

Preferred skills:
  • Experience with continuous software integration and deployment.
  • Experience with product development for the Microsoft Azure platform.
  • Experience with Git.
  • Experience with JIRA, Confluence, MS VSTS (Azure DevOps) Bamboo and other Atlassian tools.
  • Experience with Test automation and Test Management tools, like SOAP UI, qTest.
  • Experience with development of Healthcare Information technology applications.
  • Familiarity with enterprise-level models of agile development (Scaled Agile Framework)
  • Experience with professional product development in combination with speech recognition technologies and/or artificial intelligence.

Additional Information:

Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.

LI Code:
#LI-MB1
